description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in Ishigaki's Paradise" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in Ishigaki's Paradise

places.generalDescription: Fusaki Beach Resort Hotel & Villas is a laid-back beachfront resort located on top of Fusaki Beach, offering bright rooms and cottages. The spacious resort complex provides easy access to various water sports such as snorkeling, diving, canoeing, and wind surfing. It's a family-friendly luxury resort with free accommodation for children under 6. The property features pools, 4 restaurants, an open-air bar, and aroma healing spa treatments.

sources.snippet: Just a minute's walk from Fusaki Beach, FUSAKI BEACH RESORT HOTEL & VILLAS features pools, 4 restaurants and aroma healing spa treatments. Free WiFi is available throughout the property.
sources.shortName: The Best Boutique Hotels in Ishigaki by

sources.siteName: VISIT OKINAWA JAPAN | Official Okinawa Travel Guide
sources.shortName: 4 Days Exploring around Ishigaki, Taketomi, and Iriomote Islands | VISIT OKINAWA JAPAN

places.name: Fusaki Beach Resort Hotel & Villas

reviews.text: Had an absolutely lovely experience here! The beach is beautiful, the pools are great (the kids' water park is amazing!), and the food is delicious. Our room was wonderful, and the service was fantastic. This spot is perfect for couples, friends, or family trips. The price is also very reasonable, especially if you book in advance. While it's not super close to the airport, they offer a free pick-up service, which is a huge plus. It can get a bit crowded during peak season, so consider visiting during the off-season for a more relaxed vibe. Overall, wholeheartedly recommend this place to anyone!

A perfect resort for families with young children - and perhaps only families with young children!

If you're a couple seeking romance or a family with teenagers dreaming of thrilling adventures, this might not be your ideal destination. But if you're traveling with a toddler or baby in tow, welcome to paradise.

Do keep in mind, however, that the resort experience is designed almost entirely in Japanese. Staff were kind and tried their best, but their English was limited - and there was no English version of the hotel map or facility guides. We found ourselves frequently using a translation app or heading to the concierge to ask for help, which added a bit of extra time to everything.

That said, the staff's warmth, the quality of the food, and the family-friendly facilities made up for it. We'd happily come back - especially with our little one.

Overall lovely hotel and beautiful beach&pool!
Perfect for family get away!

Staff were all very polite and attentive (other than the one or two staff standing at entrance; no greeting no service maybe they serve only hotel shuttle?).  Otherwise, they were generally v quick to response.  We enjoyed our stay very much.

places.generalDescription: Kondoi Beach, located on Taketomi Island in Okinawa Prefecture, is renowned for its gentle slope and fine white sands. The emerald green waters with a shallow sandy floor make it the best beach on the island. Visitors can enjoy laying out in the sun on the large white sand beach and swimming in warm waters during high tide. However, caution is advised as strong currents and poisonous creatures like Habu Jellyfish are present from June to October.

sources.snippet: On the west of the island is perhaps the island‚Äôs best beach, Kondoi Beach, with its crystal-clear turquoise waters, soft white sand and the photogenic Nishi Pier. A ten minute walk south along the shore from Kondoi Beach leads to Kaiji Beach, which is famous for its star-shaped grains of sand.
sources.shortName: Ishigaki Itinerary - the Perfect Guide to Japan's Tropical Paradise

sources.snippet: Kondoi beach on Taketomi island is a gorgeous beach on a gorgeous small and atmospheric island. Good for swimming, pictures and sunbathing, not for snorkelling. If you want to do some serious swimming in the turquoise water check the tide online before you go.
sources.siteName: DISCOVERYAIMA - Guide to the Yaeyama islands - Travel tips for your travel to Japan
sources.shortName: Beaches in the Yaeyama archipelago - DISCOVERYAIMA - Guide to the Yaeyama islands

sources.snippet: Lastly, I would like to introduce Kondoi Beach on Taketomi Island. Taketomi Island is easily accessible from Ishigaki Island in a few dozen minutes. It is a compact island where you can enjoy leisurely sightseeing by buffalo cart or rented bicycle.

places.name: Kondoi Beach

reviews.text: If you're looking for peace, beauty and serenity, this is the beach for you!  Gentle shallow waters that is crystal clear with nary a person in sight!  Clear views of nearby islands with sparkling hues of blue and green for a far as your eyes can see.  Been to many beautiful beaches all over the world and this has got to be one of the best kept secrets.  Hats off to the locals for maintaining the natural beauty of this heavenly place.
Visited in mid-June 2025. It's about a 30-minute walk from the Taketomi Island ferry terminal. The most beautiful beach I've ever seen in my life.

Beautiful beach especially at high tide. Warning though : the crows are very aggressive and stole my clothes and sunscreen! Lock your valuables up! Also keep walking to the far side - there is lots of shade under trees around the bend and 200m further.

places.generalDescription: Kabira Tei is a Japanese steakhouse located in Ishigaki, Okinawa. The restaurant is known for serving delicious and smoky beef dishes that are cooked to perfection, offering great value for money. Guests have praised the friendly service and great atmosphere at the restaurant. The presentation of the dishes is beautiful, and the staff goes above and beyond to ensure a memorable dining experience.

sources.snippet: The steaks cooked with instant smoking of Ishigaki Misaki beef and Ishigaki beef are popular. The deliciousness of the branded meat with added depth is superb. Please enjoy the unique taste of Ishigaki beef that is different from other steaks.
sources.shortName: Itineraries For Couple from Ishigaki Port #1 | Ishigaki Port | English

sources.siteName: Islands of Japan - Travel Tips by Ippei and Janine

places.name: Kabira Tei

reviews.text: Fantastic Ishigaki Wagyu beef. Very clean restaurant. Fantastic services from the waiting staff. High recommended.

Top Izakaya restaurant serving Ishigaki Kobe Beef üçñ

The food is delicious, with perfect execution, high quality ingredients, thoughtfully crafted menu that would delight locals and foreigners.

I love the ishigaki beef, sweet potato salad, beef tartare and pork ribs. Ishigaki beef is tender and juicy.

Highly recommended for a relaxing meal featuring delicious Ishigaki beef.

The restaurant offers beef prepared in various styles, each showcasing unique flavors and textures. Every dish is perfectly seasoned to enhance the natural taste of the beef without overpowering it. Truly, it's worth every penny.

The staff is friendly, and the restaurant is spacious and clean, providing a comfortable dining atmosphere. However, dishes are served one at a time in the order they're placed, which could lead to slower service. It appears that only one chef handles the beef preparation, contributing to this delay.

In terms of menu variety, it's important to note that the focus is primarily on Ishigaki beef, with limited options for other proteins like chicken or pork.

sources.siteName: DISCOVERYAIMA - Guide to the Yaeyama islands - Travel tips for your travel to Japan
sources.shortName: Beaches in the Yaeyama archipelago - DISCOVERYAIMA - Guide to the Yaeyama islands

reviews.text: Hidden gem. Very beautiful little beach, we were lucky to stumble upon it as we saw the sun was setting and a car was parked on the side of the road. As soon as we walked onto the beach the other people were leaving so we enjoyed an amazing view and such a peaceful scene with beautiful clear calm waters. We were not planning the visit so didn't swim but it looked so inviting.

This is probably the nicest beach in Ishigaki. The sand is white and soft and the water is clear blue. There isn't any garbage and there isn't many people. The only downfall is it is a bit far from the city and there isn't much parking either.
The beach was super shallow all the way till so far that you won't even want to reach! You  can enjoy very nice snorkeling without having any issue! There are some fishes definitely.

places.generalDescription: Sukuji Beach is a hidden gem on the island, offering a kilometer-long shoreline with fine sand and clear waters. It's an ideal spot for sunbathing and leisurely dips in the shallow beach. The area is equipped with amenities like public changing rooms, showers, and restrooms for visitors' convenience. Snorkeling enthusiasts can explore the diverse marine life, including hard corals, tropical fish, sea turtles, and manta rays.

sources.snippet: Sukuji Beach is located about 10 minutes by car from Kabira Bay and is as beautiful as Kabira Bay, the most scenic beach in Ishigaki Island. Since the beach is shallow, you can enjoy activities such as swimming, playing on the beach, and snorkeling. There are also lifeguards on duty, so you can enjoy swimming in peace.

Located on the west side of Ishigaki Island, near the popular tourist spot Kabira Bay, 
Sukuji Beach
". The shallow waters and the tide 
Calm waters and a nearly 1km long white sand beach
It is a spacious swimming beach. In the evening, coupled with the crimson sunset, 
A picturesque sunset spot
is.
sources.shortName: 5 Sunset Spots in Ishigaki Island! A thorough introduction to activity tours you can enjoy while watching the sunset!

sources.snippet: This family-friendly beach is wide and shallow with gentle waves, and its white sand stretches for nearly a kilometer. The picturesque scenery reaches all the way to forested Cape Kabiraishi, whose dark green color contrasts beautifully with the turquoise ocean. Sukuji Bathing Beach
sources.shortName: 20 Fun Things to Do On Ishigaki Island, Okinawa - Places to Go, Local Food & Sightseeing Tips

sources.snippet: Sukuji Beach provides perfect conditions for marine activities, while more experienced snorkelers and divers head to the coral gardens at Yonehara Beach. Meanwhile, Sunset Beach lives up to its name with spectacular evening views and calm waters.

places.name: Sukuji Beach

reviews.text: A small, quiet beach close to the famous Kabira Bay with stunningly clear waters. Never crowded, ideal for families with children. Free parking, showers, toilets and shop. No pushy tourist traps - just pure charm.
Water is lukewarm but it has a netted off area where it‚Äòs safe to swim. The lifeguards are really cute, one guy caught a big box jellyfish outside the net and showed it to us.
Scenic but st low tide not even worth going in. The net to protect from stingers is then flat on the ground. Nice shaded setting.

places.generalDescription: Yonehara Beach, located on Ishigaki Island, is a stunning white sand beach surrounded by lush greenery and bathed by turquoise waters with vibrant coral reefs. It's known as one of the best snorkeling spots on the island, offering a chance to observe a diverse range of hard corals and tropical marine life including colorful fish, sea turtles, and manta rays. However, caution is advised due to rip currents and jellyfish in some areas.

sources.snippet: This white-sand beach is a popular place to stretch out and enjoy views of the beautiful verdant coastline, Okinawa's highest peak, Mt. Omoto, and the nearby grove of Yaeyama palms. Coral reefs are found in the waters here, and colorful tropical fish can be seen swimming near the shore.In summer the adjacent campground bustles with activity as beach campers celebrate the season. The fast current off Yonehara Beach requires that swimmers exercise caution.
sources.shortName: 20 Fun Things to Do On Ishigaki Island, Okinawa - Places to Go, Local Food & Sightseeing Tips

sources.snippet: Although this beach isn‚Äôt an officially authorized beach, there are no lifeguards or jellyfish nets, it‚Äôs the most popular beach for snorkelling. In high season it can be busy. What makes this beach so attractive is, of course, the stunning underwater world just a few steps inside the ocean.
sources.siteName: DISCOVERYAIMA - Guide to the Yaeyama islands - Travel tips for your travel to Japan
sources.shortName: Beaches in the Yaeyama archipelago - DISCOVERYAIMA - Guide to the Yaeyama islands

sources.snippet: If you want to swim with the fishes and see some beautiful coral reefs (for free, might I add) then going snorkeling at the Yonehara beach is your best option. Since it‚Äôs a free public beach, you can go snorkeling without a tour. Chances are you will see some really pretty tropical fishes.
sources.shortName: 10 Fun Things To Do In Ishigaki Island | What To Do In Ishigaki Island 2024

sources.snippet: Another popular snorkelling spot includes the coastline around the Blue Cave near Minato Beach, just a few minutes drive away from Yonehara Beach. On the south east coast of the island is Shiraho Beach is a great place to snorkel to see underwater corals.
sources.shortName: Ishigaki Itinerary - the Perfect Guide to Japan's Tropical Paradise

sources.snippet: Sukuji Beach provides perfect conditions for marine activities, while more experienced snorkelers and divers head to the coral gardens at Yonehara Beach. Meanwhile, Sunset Beach lives up to its name with spectacular evening views and calm waters.

places.name: Yonehara Beach

reviews.text: BEST snorkeling I've had ever. We went around 4pm in the afternoon in November. Parking lot was closed so we parked st the nearby community center. The water remains very shallow quite far (I could stand), but there were so much seaweed and corals. I saw two sea snakes and a sea turtle!

We parked at the camping ground (500 yen) which meant a significant walk along the beach to the safe snorkelling area. Coral
Disappointing but good fish life. At mid tide it was challenging to find a passage through the corals and I would recommend going at high tide or reasonably close to that.

Excellent experience swimming with many kinds of tropical fish and coral reefs even near the shore! No wonder many people doing snorkelling there. There is a shop right beside the parking lot where you can rent the snorkelling equipment.
Will definitely go there again!!

places.generalDescription: Maesato Beach is a picturesque spot on Ishigaki Island, known for its azure waters and white sand. It's backed by the modern ANA InterContinental Ishigaki Resort, offering guests direct access to the beach. The area is celebrated for its rare blue coral reef of Shiraho, making it one of Japan's best diving spots. Visitors can enjoy swimming and snorkeling in the super clear water or take a walk along the coast during both sunshine and sunset.

sources.snippet: Maesato Beach in the south has lifeguards and an array of facilities and activities. It is one of the closest beaches from Ishigaki Port.
sources.siteName: VISIT OKINAWA JAPAN | Official Okinawa Travel Guide

places.name: Maesato Beach

reviews.text: I'd your a hotel guest at the ana hotel. This beach I would say is the best of beaches I've visited. I haven't found many rocks. And there are even people that I've seen who swim around taking rocks and garbage out of the ocean. And beach. And personally I've not seen garbage on the beach. So if your staying at the ana hotel, which is also very good. I would definitely recommend going here. Also just for context I belive it wins over the beaches at the main Okinawa island and beaches at Thailand especially over the surin beach. Also the night sky is beautiful, and there are lots of nice small cute hermit crabs at night or big, huge ones closer to the forest.

Beautiful beach with swimming area, floating water playground and lifeguard. We rented chairs and an umbrella from the hotel beach staff and stayed all day. The floating water playground, umbrella and chairs are an additional charge of your not a hotel guest. The beach area has no shade. The swimming area a large and the water is warm. We wear water shoes to avoid rocks and shells in the water.

Nestled along the stunning coastline, this beach next to ANA Intercontinental Hotel is a vibrant hub of activity and relaxation. The soft white sands stretch along the shore, creating a picturesque setting for beachgoers.

There is a floating water park that promises endless fun. Colorful inflatable structures bob on the water, enticing adventurous spirits to climb, jump, and slide. Nearby, a sign informs visitors about rental options for parasols and chairs, ensuring everyone can find comfort under the sun.

The beach is part of the luxurious ANA InterContinental Ishigaki Resort, blending relaxation with upscale amenities. Guests can indulge in beachside services, enhancing their experience with refreshments and leisure activities. The atmosphere is lively, with people engaging in beach games, swimming, and soaking up the serene surroundings.

places.generalDescription: Akaishi Beach, located in the northern part of Ishigaki Island, offers a serene and secluded experience for visitors. The beach is known for its beautiful blue coral near the shore, making it an ideal spot for families to enjoy some leisurely snorkeling. While there are no lifeguards on duty and limited facilities available, the tranquil atmosphere and pristine waters make it a perfect escape from crowded tourist spots.

sources.snippet: Akeeesi365 is a comfortable log house accommodation located only 5 minutes‚Äô walk from the beautiful Akaishi beach, surrounded by nature. Travel light and save on baggage costs with an amazing array of amenities provided, just bring your clothes. There are even amenities for your pet in this pet-friendly log house!
sources.siteName: Guidable  - Your Guide to a Sustainable, Wellbeing-centred Life in Japan Guidable
sources.shortName: Travel to Ishigaki Island for Pristine Beaches and Starry Skies | Guidable

places.name: Akaishi Beach

reviews.text:
From my point of view, this is the best beach to visit in Ishigaki Island. Visited there in mid september. Warm water. Very clean water. No waves at all. Only two places to park your car. So better be hurry.
If you are trying to avoid crowd, then this the perfect place. But there are no bathing facilities. Actually no other facilities. But you can enjoy a private time. Enjoy ultra blue ocean and pure white sandy beach.

A not so well trekked beach. The coastline is long and scenic. It only takes a 3min walk from the beachside town on sandy roads. Unfortunately the beach is littered with trash washed into the beach from the ocean.
This beach has the potential to be a amazing place but not in its current state. Full of trash and garbage everywhere.

places.generalDescription: Yonehara Beach is a natural sandy beach known for its vibrant marine life, making it a popular spot for snorkeling. The coral reefs are easily accessible from the shore, offering clear waters teeming with colorful fish. Visitors are advised to be cautious of currents and Habu jellyfish. The beach provides amenities such as a parking lot and restrooms. However, due to its popularity, it can get crowded, so arriving early is recommended.
places.name: Yonehara Beach

reviews.text:
The best snorkeling beach in Okinawa! I've been to many islands, but this one is the far best! So many corals right off the beach!  Water is so clear that you can see fish without swimming!
It was so many corals and hard to swim through. It was really sad to see families and kids were standing on the corals I really hope people don't destroy corals to preserve beautiful beach üò¢
Go early as it gets busy. We went on Monday around 10:00 in July, but it was already busy. Only few spots for free parking. Rest is 500 yen. Shower is ¬•300, so you might want to bring water to rinse yourself.

Although the beach is said to be beautiful, beware of the numerous car parks around it, which seem designed to exploit tourists. It's easy to be misled and getting to the beach can be a challenge. A top spot to avoid.

The beach itself is not so special, by far not the most beautiful one. But it's a must do if you like snorkeling. You can rent the equipment, the access is easy and the reef is gorgeous, you just need to get in 10m and the variety of fish is impressive. Great spot for snorkeling, for beaching not so special tho.
